thread.title: Fun food things to do in R.I. the week of Oct. 14
thread.title_full: Fun food things to do in R.I. the week of Oct. 14

author: Gail Ciampaâ€© Journal Staff Writer
title: Fun food things to do in R.I. the week of Oct. 14
text: Fun food things to do in R.I. the week of Oct. 14 Beervana Fest and a game dinner in Cranston, a turkey supper with all the fixings in Warwick, and a wine dinner in North Kingstown. Comment By Gail CiampaJournal Staff Writer Posted Oct. 14, 2015 @ 12:01 am Beervana Fest '15, open to persons over 21, will be held Friday, Oct. 16, from 6:30 to 10 p.m. at Rhodes on the Pawtuxet, 60 Rhodes Place, Cranston. Forty-five tables will feature more than 200 beers. Tickets, $50 on online, $60 at the door (if available) include a tasting glass, 2-ounce pours, seminars, a fest guide and a bottle of water. To purchase, go to beervanafest.com . Scalabrini Council Knight of Columbus will hold its annual game dinner prepared by Ralph's Catering at Kelley-Gazzerro VFW Post #2812, 1418 Plainfield St., Cranston, Sunday, Oct. 18, at 12:30 p.m. The menu will include bruschetta, antipasto, soup, pasta with venison meatballs, venison sausage, wild boar and peas, venison Marsala, rabbit, and venison meatloaf served with potatoes. The cost is $30. To reserve, call Peter Lentini at (401) 944-2613. The 63rd annual turkey supper of Norwood Baptist Church, 48 Budlong Ave., Warwick, will be held Saturday, Oct. 17, with seatings at 5 and 7 p.m. The meal includes buffet-style rolls, sliced roasted turkey, stuffing, gravy, whipped potatoes, butternut squash, green beans, cranberry sauce, beverages and pie. The cost is $10, $4 for children 3 to 10. Tickets will not be sold at the door; to reserve, call (401) 941-7040 or email NorwoodBaptist1@gmail.com . The North Kingstown Chamber of Commerce will present Taps, Corks and a Five Course Fare , a five-course meal with celebrity servers paired with wines from various vineyards and beers from Revival Brewery, from 5 to 8 p.m. Sunday at Sonoma Bistro & WineBar, 7366 Post Rd., North Kingstown. Tickets, $75, may be obtained by calling Janet Jacques at the chamber at (401) 295-5566.
